<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
0580/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[755, 325, 904, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 621]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 219, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 70.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
For each of 10 people working in an office, the scatter diagram shows their salary and the value of their car.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 112, 868, 666]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 680, 144, 698]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 680, 500, 700]]<|/det|>
One of these people has a salary of $28 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 712, 364, 730]]<|/det|>
Find the value of their car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[625, 742, 920, 761]]<|/det|>

Another person starts to work in the office.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 789, 609, 808]]<|/det|>
Their salary is $54 000 and the value of their car is $6100.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 820, 500, 838]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 821, 920, 839]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 171, 89]]<|/det|>
Solve.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 87, 351, 106]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 490, 923, 508]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 535, 603, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of 2021 there were 27 000 rhinos living in the wild.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 551, 720, 570]]<|/det|>
The number of rhinos is expected to decrease exponentially by \(3\%\) each year.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 581, 868, 616]]<|/det|>
Work out the number of rhinos expected to be living in the wild 4 years later, at the end of 2025. Give your answer correct to the nearest whole number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 532, 920, 567]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[267, 579, 710, 599]]<|/det|>
\[y > 1\qquad x\leqslant 2\qquad y\geqslant x + 2\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 656, 260, 675]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 687, 562, 706]]<|/det|>
